intro: Scaphium burkillfilii, commonly known as the Burkill's scaphium, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and yellow. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
